clinical_study.brief_title: Early Reassessment of Intravenous Antiinfective Therapy Due to "Antiinfective Reminders" (AIR Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Early Reassessment of Intravenous Antiinfective Therapy Due to "Antiinfective Reminders" (AIR Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Switching from intravenous application of antiinfective agents to oral therapy is often performed late including high costs and risk of complications. This study will investigate the impact of displayed reminders in the electronic patient chart after 60h of intravenous therapy with an antiinfective agent.

detailed_description.textblock: Switching from intravenous application of antiinfective agents to oral therapy is often performed late including high costs, risk of complications as well as higher workload on nursing. This study will investigate the impact of displayed reminders in the electronic patient chart after 60h of intravenous therapy with an antiinfective agent.

primary_outcome.measure: duration of intravenous antiinfective therapy until switching

secondary_outcome.measure: costs (per year, per day and patient)
ratio of narrow to broad-spectrum antibiotics

clinical_study.condition: Infection as Complication of Medical Care

arm_group.description: Behavioral: Early switching from intravenous to oral antiinfective agents due to electronic reminders
Behavioral: Early switching from intravenous to oral antiinfective agents without computerized decision support

intervention.description: Behavioral: Early switching from intravenous to oral antiinfective agents due to electronic reminders

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- all in-patients in treatment with an intravenous antiinfective for >60h,
- hospitalized in a ward with computerized physician order entry (cpoe)
Exclusion criteria:
- outpatients,
- ward without cpoe,
- no intravenous antiinfective treatment
